Name: Hurricane
Ingredients: 45 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Hurricane glass .
Prepare garnish of pineapple wedge & Luxardo Maraschino Cherry .
STRAIN into glass filled with crushed ice.
Review: A strong, tangy, refreshing drink packed with fruit and laced with rum.
History: Named after the shape of a hurricane lamp and served in the tall, shapely glass of the same name. Thought to have originated in 1939 at The Hurricane Bar in New York City, but made famous at Pat O'Brien's in New Orleans . Some old cocktail books list a much earlier Hurricane made with cognac, absinthe and vodka.
Nutrition: One serving of Hurricane contains 237 calories
